item.description:
Taking in the evergreen forest of late Fall as Christmas approaches, the rippling stream, and the soothing din of the waterfall.

A very easy and lovely fairly level 2-3 mile hike at the Belding Trout Management Area in Vernon. This roughly 1.75 hour long hike is very pleasant and is great for beginners and is scenic enough with the forest, stream, and dammed pond to interest more advanced hikers. This area is a hidden gem and even connects to Valley Falls, the Hop River Linear Trail, the Schinipsit Trail, and some Northern Connecticut Land trust property! How's that for location?

Meet at trailhead parking (end of cul-de-sac on Tamarac Ln., Vernon, CT) but this can be somewhat limited depending on the number of attendees.

Kids and dogs on leash welcome.

Sunset around 4:18 PM but we will be done by no later than 4 PM.
